review: This app appears to be a waste of time, & free, but it is neither. Unless you open this app and try it you will never know how good it is. Totally logical app written by people who have a plan to teach, and know how to explain coding, which is not in the others I tried, they are very confusing and no structure or plan to get you there for your individual needs. Right from the start on this app you have to choose what you want to learn, and the level you want to learn at. The the first lesson is free, after that a reduced yearly promotion is offered, and is it so worth it. It is like a self paced college class that is not al over the place. All hands on and explains what you did all the way through. Look no further than here, this is the app for coding hand down the best that I‚Äôve seen and tried.
title: Not what it appears to be

developerResponse: {'id': 5440046, 'body': "Hi Zoster. Many thanks for using Mimo and your extensive feedback - it's much appreciated, as our user's satisfaction is our primary concern. Have a great day!", 'modified': '2018-10-10T10:32:14Z'}
review:
I just got this app and wiped through some of the first lessons, but got completely thrown off when I needed to get a subscription to go anywhere past the first levels. 
Honestly I bet that may be a flaw and a cause for people to leave the app as soon as they get it. 
A suggestion for this would be maybe look at letting users do higher levels, but without a subscription put the it on a time limit. If funding is that big of an issue, I don‚Äôt really know how well newer users will do. For example:

Letting users unlock all the levels, however. For every activity (getting started, etc.) have an extended wait until they could do the next level (30 mins, 3 hrs, 1 day, etc.). This way users would still be pushed to get a subscription, but can still access and enjoy the app. Also, maybe insert adds in-between lessons for non-subscriptions, or you could even put the option of using adds to shorten the wait time by a bit. 

That being said, the app in itself looks really great! Which is why I give it four stars, it‚Äôs just the fact that you need at LEAST a $10 subscription to go past the first level of any course that I wouldn‚Äôt really recommend it yet. But that‚Äôs no excuse to stop yourself from trying it! I appreciate you taking time to hear my thoughts, cya!
title: Great idea, troubling activity.

developerResponse: {'id': 3271176, 'body': "Thanks for your feedback, es206! We've heard you, and done both: 1) we've fixed the issues with the lessons that you addressed and 2) we've included a 3 months subscription. Have you seen it? Please let us know what you think! You can either answer directly to this review or send us an email to feedback@getmimo.com We're looking forward to hearing from you!", 'modified': '2018-04-26T13:33:02Z'}
review:
In c# ‚Äùmain and system‚Äù lesson 2, there are no options, and an error message is displayed when you hit solve. After that you can‚Äôt move on to the next lesson. This is on the latest iPad Pro. 

Also some c# lessons write incorrect output. I filed reports for those. You also suddenly use the ‚Äúthis‚Äù keyword in a class lesson without even mentioning it (it‚Äôs kind of important). The app is well designed, but some of the lessons could use a good editing pass. 

In addition, the subscription is priced as if you would study every programming language in creation. Generally people only need a few and there really isn‚Äôt enough content in any single language that you cover to justify mandatory 1 year/ $50 subscriptions. Maybe the idea is to dip your toes into everything, but I really think 3 month subscriptions make more sense if you have faith that your product and future content can retain customers.
title: Buggy lessons and yearly subscriptions

review:
I'm really enjoying mimo. It's the perfect train/subway ride time killer that doesn't feel like you're mindlessly hacking away at a game. Love the content tracks they've chosen. I think it's totally worth paying for, assuming they keep new content coming regularly. 

That said, the quality of some lessons feels a bit below what is acceptable - occasional typos, questions that are poorly worded, and answer input UI that is strange (having me input "var" from three separate out of order letter buttons is awkward and isn't really testing my knowledge, a regular keyboard in those situations would be much better). Instead of a thumbs up / down at the end of each lesson, perhaps just have a flag (!) on each question to identify edits and get more specific feedback. 

Regardless, I like mimo's approach and look forward to seeing where they take this platform.
title: Great format for bite sized learning, needs polish

developerResponse: {'id': 3271239, 'body': "Thanks for your feedback, Dragon_Aries! We're about to try out different pricing models. We'll also be sure to increase the amount of free content in the near future ‚Äì stay tuned! We're already working on that. üìª", 'modified': '2018-04-26T13:37:32Z'}
review:
Edit: found a subscription plan that works for me. Will rate this app 5 stars once monthly subscriptions are available to everyone. So far, though, the app is easy to understand and kinda fun. I like it ^^
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
If it was like $4.17 a month for 3 months‚Äî or even 6 months‚Äî I‚Äôd be a lot more comfortable purchasing the subscription. Which, by the way, is required to get past the first lesson. But, it‚Äôs for a year. Which is really $50 a year. I don‚Äôt want to spend $50 on something unless I REALLY want it. So, app developers, you should really listen to all the feedback saying this: Either lower the price, lower the required subscription length, or give a one or two week free trial with unlimited access. Believe it or not, it‚Äôll more than likely increase your customers and income.

That aside‚Äî Actually, no. I won‚Äôt review the quality of the app until I can actually use it. For less than $50.
title: Subscription is practically required

review: Mimo is an app for learning programming languages and other computer science topics on the go. Each lesson consists of a series of short presentations which you can get through in little time but which, all together, add up to a robust introduction to a particular computer science topic. I have hesitated to give a review of this app until now as, until recently, there have not been any new releases for this app. However, in the last week or so, there have been two releases one that fixed typos and the other that added two new computer science topics. In addition, the app creators promise more topic releases in the near future. I am especially interested in the non programming language topics as not to many on the go learning app creators add these kind of topics.
title: Great potential and fast release cycle so far

We take your feedback seriously and are also trying to improve the content we show before we ask you for a subscription. Best, your developers at Mimo', 'modified': '2018-11-10T07:17:22Z'}
review: I love this app. I downloaded it because of it‚Äôs promise of teaching me about coding. I did read that the app did have purchases, but thought it wouldn‚Äôt get in my way. When I opened the app, I selected gaming and it ran me through the first lesson. After completing it, I felt excited to go to the next course. But to my surprise, the app blocked me from at least getting a firm grip on coding. It said I had to pay 9.99 a month. The thing I thought was dumb was not that the app asked me for 9.99 a month, but that it didn‚Äôt let me have a firm grasp before stopping me. When I read, ‚ÄúGame contains in-app purchases,‚Äù I didn‚Äôt expect it to stop me after the first lesson. Please change it so that people can not only learn how to make the console say something, but also how to make a platforming game. Thank you for reading this, please take this into account.
title: Good and all, but...

review:
Okay I only put five so I could get to the top but I‚Äôll give it a ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è because it gives you a good amount of choices to pick from and it also gives you a very clear, first lesson, idea of the topic you picked. title: I absolutely love mimo a little bit

review: If not one single thing in the app is going to be free, and I‚Äôm not talking about a free trial of the paid stuff, the just charge for the app! When developers make their apps free but nothing in the app is actually free, except for a free trial that takes your credit card info anyway, it makes customers feel lied to. Just be upfront with it, this looks like a great app and of course people will jump on it if it‚Äôs ‚Äúfree‚Äù! If developers are going to keep their apps free but charge for content, which is understandable because developers have rent to pay and food to buy too, I‚Äôd recommend at least making an introductory level content free so customers can try it out before deciding to make a regular financial commitment. People are hesitant to just give credit card info for free trials, there have been more than one company and more than one instance where cards got charged anyway or purchases were made without the cardholder‚Äôs consent.
title: Just charge for the app

review: The app could be better in correcting your mistakes when you get a wrong answer, so there is some motivation required to teach yourself because the app isn‚Äôt going to do all that for you. With that said, there are plenty of courses and resources. After a week of using it, I‚Äôve already learned a lot of valuable information. Yes you can find all this information for free online, but the style of the app is almost like the learn tool on quizlet and is very effective and fun.  The price kinda motivates you to get more use out of the app in a month, which helped me learn faster haha. If you want to learn coding in a fun user friendly way I say go for it. It really depends on what kind of learner you are. For me, this is the best way.
title: Worth the money

developerResponse: {'id': 4651745, 'body': "Hi, Patrickl27! Thanks for taking the time to write this review. It's fantastic to hear that you are a Swifty user. üòçWe understand you and will try to increase the amount of free content to give you a better idea of how the app looks like. We'll also have a second look at our intro to hacking to start with a more serious tone. (The later chapters go by the way deep into actually applying your hacking skills with real world projects. If you like our Swifty content, you'll love our Mimo content!) Feel free to send us more feedback to feedback@getmimo.com! We'd love to read from you again!", 'modified': '2018-08-14T13:22:25Z'}
review: I have, and like Swifty, also by this developer. The problem with this app is that it has a super expensive recurring purchase as the only way to unlock lessons beyond the first 2 for every subject, which in some case teaches absolutely nothing about the subject. For example, in the "hacking" category, it only teaches the ridiculous "1337 speek", which, in addition to being common sense, is completely unrelated and irrelevant to actual (read: not dramatized in movies by technologically illiterate people) hacking! There is no way to know without subscribing if later lessons in the subject will actually take themselves seriously, or continue being ridiculous and entirely irrelevant to the stated subject matter. This app needs an option for a single time purchase of either individual subjects (priced $1-5), or the entire app (priced $5-20), to be remotely accessible for the vast majority of its target market!
title: Much too expensive, especially for unproven content

title: Trying to reset password

We need to make sure we can pay our teachers fairly and right now that means charging for our service. We hope you'll give us another try in the future. - The Mimo Team", 'modified': '2018-07-13T22:27:10Z'}
review:
Although I am fairly disappointed with this app, as it requests money to buy the premium version to unlock any chapter after the first, it shows great promise in programming for kids. Honestly I am excited to see what‚Äôs to come, and if you‚Äôre reading this and are thinking about downloading the app, you should totally try it.

My response to The Mimo Team:
Thank you for your response Mimo Team, I know you worked hard on this app and are trying to raise some money, all I was trying to say (though I was rather annoyed with the app at the time of my writing) was that you should add more chapters before asking for the premium version. Perhaps you could use ads and we could pay to not have to watch them? Anyways I have changed my review to be more acceptable (üòÇ) and more helpful for people reading it. Thank you for your response, and I‚Äôm excited to see what‚Äôs to come with the app.
title: Really disappointed

review: I attended a coding boot camp at the beginning of the year (while also going through chemo). I was so disappointed in the instruction that I finished part one and got my money back for part two. I am an aggressive self-learner. I‚Äôve read coding books, watched videos, etc. and a few things just weren‚Äôt clicking because they were the basics and most skip over that part. I absolutely love this app because it breaks everything down and repeats in different ways to really drive home the rule or syntax. By using this app I have been able to piece everything I‚Äôve learned together to almost feel like I can teach this material. Keep up the good work! Thank you for what you do! Not everyone learns the same way!
title: Fantastic app!

developerResponse: {'id': 4270396, 'body': 'Hi there, Thank you very much for submitting your review - user feedback is much appreciated by our team. Yes, only the first two lessons of our every course, as this is how much free content we can afford at the moment. We do want our app to be affordable for as many people as possible while allowing us to pay the rent and the salaries of our programmers and designers. Good news though: our team is doing its best to increase the amount of free content so keep your eyes on Mimo! Again, thanks a lot for your feedback and have a nice day! Cheers!', 'modified': '2018-07-17T09:31:58Z'}
review: I am really thinking about buying the $30 for a year pass, because honestly if you are serious about coding and have an income it would be a no brainer, except for the fact that I was only able to use about 5 minutes of the app before being halted and told to purchase a subscription. Now being told to get a subscription after an appropriate trial would be reasonable but after just a few minutes on the app? This makes me think there must not be enough content for you to justify a longer trial period and therefore not enough for me to buy it, so I really wish you would reconsider the way you let people try out this app. Maybe let them use it for an entire day or something, that way they can actually learn for an hour or two instead of just feeling like they have no idea what the app really would contain if they paid for it.
title: Offer a better trial experience

developerResponse: {'id': 3215064, 'body': "Hi there! We make the app available for free, so you can try out before committing to a subscription. We'd love to hear from you what you didn't like about our introduction chapters to improve Mimo. You can either answer directly to this review or send us an email to feedback@getmimo.com We're looking forward to hearing from you!", 'modified': '2018-06-24T18:07:49Z'}
review:
The only thing free about this app is the bogus flat intro of each lesson. Then it‚Äôs $50-60/year or $30 for 3 months.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Update: 
I gave in and decided to subscribe. The lessons in some areas are decent while in others are still too rudimentary to even consider oneself a novice after passing their last level. Overall I‚Äôd give it 2.5 stars if possible, because it‚Äôs half way there. 
The program itself is a great concept not lacks execution. I joined to see if it had more depth, and really it doesn‚Äôt. I‚Äôve been in the tech field for over 20 years and I‚Äôve done programming (no expert, but I can hold my own), SQL Database Administration, Ethical Hacking, and Systems Administration. I would like to think I know what I‚Äôm talking about. 
The program has promise but needs more practical content rather than multiple choice options. If there‚Äôs a way to involve an emulator for programming, or establish a bit more real-world application of concepts. Learning the vocabulary and verbiage is great, but when it comes to practice it‚Äôs very different than in the app. 
I would also suggest that the concepts have a common theme. That way the user can follow a storyline throughout. 
For me, it‚Äôs a waste of money. For a absolutely newbie to programming it might help, but 3-4 courses on Udemy or Coursera costing $10 each might give you a better handle on it than the app, and still cost less.
title: Supposedly Free

developerResponse: {'id': 3271449, 'body': "Thanks for your feedback, Daveysprite! We've heard you and included a 3 months subscription. Have you seen it? Please let us know what you think! We'll also be sure to increase the amount of free content in the near future ‚Äì stay tuned! We're already working on that. üìª", 'modified': '2018-04-26T13:53:06Z'}
review: The app looks and feels smooth and intuitive, but it‚Äôs advertised as free only to be backed up behind an enormous paywall of $40 a year, which isn‚Äôt too bad but it sure feels like it considering it was shown as free and is also a huge chunk of money at one time for an app you don‚Äôt even know if you‚Äôll like enough to use for the entire year. If the app was on the store for like 4.99 or maybe a little more i might consider it, but i really hate subscriptions, especially ones that don‚Äôt offer 1 month options in case i don‚Äôt even like it. The introduction wasn‚Äôt really beneficial at all so it doesn‚Äôt tell me anything about what the app actually teaches. It feels and looks like DuoLingo but for coding, but it just doesn‚Äôt go about it the right way. I think they‚Äôd get more business if they went about the paywall differently. Hopefully they‚Äôll get on that sometime.
title: Either make it free or offer a flat price.

review: I paid for a subscription because of how easy and helpful the lessons were for the first section of the ‚Äúmake a game‚Äù category, but there‚Äôs a big problem once you get past the basic course. When you start off, the lesson tells you what everything is an almost unnecessary amount of times, and that‚Äôs a great thing because of how hard it is to teach something as complex as coding. But once I got into the intermediate course I was immediately hit with several terms that I had never seen before like ‚Äúint‚Äù and ‚Äústatic void‚Äù which I was completely confused on and things simply became harder to follow after that. Coming in I had no understanding of how to do C# and the first lesson was pretty well made which is why I give 3 stars, but I still would have preferred more detailed lessons past the first.
title: It‚Äôs great! Up to a point.

review: Don‚Äôt be fooled by this free app. While it is free to download you can‚Äôt truly use the full app unless you pay for a subscription. The only thing you can use it for without paying is the first lesson of the very basic things everything else is locked. I was very disappointed because I love coding and I wanted to learn more. When I opened this app I was very happy because it was well organized. Unfortunately because of the subscription you have to pay to really learn something I no longer want this app. To the creators of this app I recommend that you should have at least most of the beginner lessons free and then you must pay to learn more of the difficult coding. I hope my recommendation is considered because I know that other users have poorly reviewed because of this issue. You should not get this app if you don‚Äôt want to pay for some subscription.
title: Very nice but not free

review:
I've been using the app for a little while now and it's a great thing during down time, but there are a lot of little features that need to be added for a better user experience. 

First there needs to be a "back" button to visit the page you just passed. I often want to go back and reference something and can not. There needs to be a "close" button when you finish the lesson. You shouldn't have to proceed and then close. When you answer a question correctly it should be a little easier (and encouraged) to try the wrong answers to see what would happen or what the result would be. 

If these features were implemented I would give the app an additional star. My only other hang up is that I would feel more comfortable if this app was $5 a month instead of $9.
title: Overall it's good

developerResponse: {'id': 5731401, 'body': 'Hi there. We read and hear your feedback. Our team is working on it, and soon more free content will be available, which hopefully will help you to get a better glimpse into the structure and information provided by our courses. Stay tuned!', 'modified': '2018-10-30T17:12:14Z'}
review:
Apart from the fact that I hate being cornered into signing up for something when it hasn't showed if it's actually worth it, I went into the "Hackers" track and went through the intro. It was interesting until we got to the question where it basically asks why do people hack.

Right answer was revenge. Seriously? Revenge? Please... you got script-kiddies, Nation States, Insiders, Hacktivists, and criminal organizations that all hack for revenge? And not money? (Which I got it wrong by selection money out of the three options which was the most obvious one). 

I would've signed but to learn more and compare what I've learned throughout Udemy courses. This was a big letdown.
title: Not accurate

developerResponse: {'id': 9596070, 'body': "Hi there. Thanks for your feedback. We've now updated the app so you're able to revisit already seen content to keep your knowledge fresh. If you haven't updated now is your chance. Have a great day!", 'modified': '2019-07-10T14:50:57Z'}
review: I really like learning with this program BUT these are complex ideas to someone who is new to programming. Don‚Äôt make the mistake I did. Take notes! After the lesson write down as much as you can remember bc you won‚Äôt be able to retake or reference the lesson in the future. You can only access the recharge portion. Why would they limit us in this way ‚Äî no idea! Just make it a habit even if it seems like you‚Äôre remembering it easily at the beginning. The ideas build off of each other and their is no reviewing and incorporation of past lessons. I do recommend Mimo but this is a really ridiculous restriction‚Äî and I can‚Äôt go back and retake the lessons without starting a new account and paying again, so...
title: Take notes!

title: I like the app, but why do I need to pay for everything?

developerResponse: {'id': 4651781, 'body': "Wow, funsession, thank you for the really kind words! You put smiles on people's faces all around the office. Reviews like yours motivate us to do our best work and build out even more features that you will enjoy! Cheers, The Mimo Team", 'modified': '2018-08-14T13:25:13Z'}
review:
The first thing I noticed was ‚Äúfree with in app purchases‚Äù, which I am thankful for as you don‚Äôt have to make a blind purchase. From the start, you are prompted to choose a learning objective. This is great because programming has different focuses and you decide what you want to learn and when.

Each lesson slide is taught with real-world examples, and I find that it makes each concept easy to understand. Whether you are right or wrong on a built-in quiz answer, the concept is reiterated as the goal is to make you learn.

I find this app to be very useful as I can study anytime and any place, and of great value at $2.50/month.
title: Step-by-step learning

review:
Dear Mimo,

I love the concept of this app and a lot of things are made quite clear and concise through the lessons. I found the introduction to hacking very straightforward. However, I see a _lot_ of mistakes in the lessons, especially typos or missing words in the exercises, which sometimes makes it unclear what the exercise is actually even about. I‚Äôve been trying to report these kinds of things but have so far received no indication that my reports have even been received. I was also a bit disappointed by the need to pay $50/year in order to do just about anything in the app. You really should give a more in-depth preview before you force people to pay. Also, if you already have programming experience, it‚Äôs unclear if you can skip ahead to more advanced topics. Maybe the target audience is only complete beginners, but if that‚Äôs the case then the $50/year is _definitely_ not worth it. Also, as sort of a side note, the update notes here on the App Store are bugged out. How can you not have noticed that???

Please extend your preview, fix your errors, lower the cost, and add content for more advanced users. I don‚Äôt think you want people to feel like they‚Äôre being scammed.

Best wishes,
Ben
title: Not quite there

review: How are people giving this app low ratings just because it‚Äôs not completely free. It‚Äôs an amazing app and very beginner friendly. Even at 10/month, for the skills you learn from it, it is totally worth the money. When my trail was over, I was offered a year subscription for I think 25$, so I jumped on the chance. And for someone in the reviews saying they don‚Äôt respond, I got a response in hours. Sure there are some flaws but they are always improving and adding new chapters to existing courses. I‚Äôve never tried any other coding app, but I would 100% recommend this app, even for the mere price of 10$/month.
title: Don‚Äôt understand

developerResponse: {'id': 523185, 'body': "Thanks for your honest feedback. We appreciate it. We're already working on bringing the feature back that allows you to select a specific lesson. Also, we're working on all performance issues to make learning with Mimo as smooth as possible.", 'modified': '2017-10-05T14:48:47Z'}
review:
The addition of the tracks update is really killing the experience. I love this app and going through the courses but the last update is making it very difficult. The app is slow to launch, freezes at start up and not as responsive when scrolling through the the chapters. 

Also please bring back the ability to select a lesson in the chapter.

Update: switched  the 2 star to 3. glad the individual lesson selection is back, but it's still seems buggy. Switching between tabs takes a sec to load the content and the initial launch of the app also still freezes up for a sec as the content loads.

Update 2: The app has gotten less buggy. There is still a small freeze that happens when I return to the app from a different one but that may be an issue with iOS 11. I do like the fact that I can get to individual lessons again. I do think they should return the visual that showed the completion of a lesson. Right now I have no idea whether or not I successfully completed a quiz or not. Whether I get the answer right or wrong it still gives me credit for that section. Please change that.
title: Very buggy update

review:
Installed because I haven't coded in many years and am looking to get reacquainted with my old friend, this app fits the bill perfectly. 
Content is effective and presented in a fun and entertaining way, and has greatly helped with recalling syntax (and even learning some new languages). No, $50 ain't cheap, but you'll spend $100 on a used C# book, this will teach you 7-8 with the promise of upcoming content. As to the 'unproven developer' bit, I had an issue with payment and an executive from the team reached out personally to help, over the course of a few emails I'm convinced they are the real deal and look forward to further features (RPi please!).
title: Great app, great support

developerResponse: {'id': 5342324, 'body': 'Hi there. Thanks much for the kind words - our team is thrilled to hear that you consider Mimo an awesome app. Keep up the good work!', 'modified': '2018-10-03T13:45:17Z'}
review: This is an awesome tool all on its own, but I use it along with LinkedIn Learning. This way I get to put into practice what I listened to and was shown by the other service. It‚Äôs all the same information to learn so it‚Äôs nice having it come from 2 different places and this one being SO hands on makes me want to pay more attention. You can‚Äôt move on to the next page until you get the answers right. There is no ‚Äúhelp‚Äù feature you can purchase. You literally have to learn and retain the information that‚Äôs provided for you in the lesson. It‚Äôs amazing!! I‚Äôd give it 10 stars if I could.
title: I‚Äôm also using LinkedIn Learning

In the future, they could become actual certifications that grade your programming skills. But we still need to work some more on challenges and tests before we can move in this direction. We hope this helps, Mr. Loaf.', 'modified': '2019-11-28T14:52:46Z'}
review:
So far I have purchased it for the year with their sale that was up a week ago, when will there be a sale again for my friends to also join? (They are unsure if its worth the 60$)

I‚Äôve been at it for a week now. I will say some spots are in need of repetition when it moves ‚Äútoo fast‚Äù but, that‚Äôs a very simple fix. I really like the way it makes the lessons interactive and keeps my attention to whats being defined in the lesson. 

One question I had though. What is the purpose of the certificates? Is it just a nice knick knack to finishing the app courses? Or can something come out of that?
title: Great lessons for beginners

developerResponse: {'id': 5872063, 'body': "Hi there. Many thanks for using Mimo and for rating our courses. Our team is thrilled to hear that you are enjoying our app. Anytime you have any questions, or you get stuck on a challenge, feel free to contact our team at support@getmimo.com, and we'll come back to you as soon as possible.", 'modified': '2018-11-09T09:31:07Z'}
review: So I enjoy using this so much so that i can‚Äôt put it down. But I couldn‚Äôt solve my first challenge. That‚Äôs a problem for me. And there are only two challenges. I think that it should be five plus challenges. I also believe they the system should automatically update your challenges as you progress in level rather than having to wait a whole day just to be challenged two more times. I like the app. It is Straightforward and to the point. I like that. I also like to see a section for terms learned and a review section. Because the days I don‚Äôt practice i can always do a quick review of what i learned.
title: There‚Äôs always room for improvement üòÅ

review: I got this app a month ago and have already completed 4 Skills. As soon as l downloaded it I got a ITunes gift card and got the premium. This is a great app for anyone who likes coding or just wants to have a great time. What I am waiting for is when they release the Raspberry Pi skill! I wish they will release it as soon as possible or send notifications in app or off the app like they do for goal reminders to tell us when each skill is coming out. Over all I love this app and constantly keep earning badges as it is competitive and fun to do with friends to see who can complete a skill first.
title: Coding For Everyone!

review: I‚Äôve been diving into languages such as CSS and HTML5 recently and I‚Äôve been looking for an efficient way to continue to learn on-the-go. This app has great potential from what I‚Äôve seen, but you can only look at one lesson (and that lesson is just 4 or 5 very very basic knowledge questions), then the everything else in the app is locked until you pay $4.16/mo ($50/yr). I would have loved to use this app because it was advertised as free and it looked very promising, but then it requires a monthly subscription to get any use whatsoever out of it. I‚Äôm just straight up disappointed. If it was more along the lines of a $2.00-$2.50/mo subscription I may have been able to give in to it, but I just don‚Äôt want to pay $50/yr for something I can‚Äôt even preview what I‚Äôm paying for.
title: Disappointed.

review:
I learned a little bit of JavaScript back in the day, but went of to pursue a different passion of mine.  I love that I can come enjoy a game and start working my way back to my true long term goal, making Videogames.  MiMo does just that and much much more.  They are truely an Innovative and super intelligent team that created this genius APP/Secret to improving your life through success.

Give this a Chance!  If you love learning new things and want to move up in your career goals faster, then this 5/5 APP will blow your mind at how much you can actually enjoy learning!! 

Thanks!!!
title: Amazing!!! Best APP to come out this Year!

review:
I did the two free lessons, and the content seems good and similar to some other apps I've tried. I enjoyed the way the content was delivered, and would happily pay to continue using the service. 

However, it seems very misleading to advertise 'Premium' when there doesn't appear to be any other subscription option. You pay for 'Premium' or you get the first lesson or two of each library. 

Additionally, I cannot justify paying for a year up front, and that is where the app/service lost me. It advertises a $4.17/month cost, but there appears to be no way to be billed monthly. You either pay for a year or you're out of luck. Not only is that also misleading (don't advertise the monthly cost of you can't do a monthly billing option), but it is hard to pay that much when I don't know if there is enough content for me to be using the service for a year. 

Should an option for monthly billing be added, I would gladly try the 'Premium' option. I hope the app is successful either way because I think there is a huge market for programming learning/training via mobile devices.
title: Content seems good, pricing options do not

review:
Man, that was brutal. It was also 5 minutes of my life I will never get back. The introductory section (the only part of the app that's free) goes over how to make a PB&J (yes, the sandwich), what to do when you encounter a door to a room, and a multiple choice question asking which of the listed possible answers are computer programs. Can't make that up.

Y'all have got to give the people more than that before attempting to initiate a conversation about buying your product. I have purchased many, many apps over the years, but only ones that have proven their worth first. I'm sure the app is great, guys, but you have to prove it before many will be willing to pay money for it. I really hope y'all decide to include a section that even remotely discusses what programming is before asking anything about subscribing to the product. 

That's like paying somebody for cutting your hair before they've even picked up the scissors. 

I cannot even fathom how many potential customers are saying "forget this" and moving onto something else. 

Until y'all include just a LITTLE bit more before you start asking people to take their wallet out, I've gotta ask - 

How's that goin' for ya?
title: Gotta give the people more than that

developerResponse: {'id': 5507350, 'body': "Hi there. Before you download the app, it is mentioned that it contains in-app purchases. The app is free to download, and as well the first chapter of all our many courses. The yearly subscription is billed as a one-time charge, and as you already mentioned, this info is available before you make your purchase. In case you are still having issues with your refund, please contact Apple's support team.", 'modified': '2018-10-15T14:04:06Z'}
review: When I originally downloaded this app, I was under the impression this would consist of free lessons. Of course, upon completing the first course and trying to move on to the next I was prompted to purchase a subscription. This was very disappointing since I was hoping I could learn for free but I considered purchasing a membership especially when I saw that the year long subscription was $2.50/mo. I started to go through the process of purchasing the subscription when I noticed that it would be an annual bill of ~$30 which I was less in favor of. So I stopped the set up and even went through the App Store to make sure that the subscription was cancelled and everything but then the charge still showed up on my account. So long story short, I just paid $30 for 1 day access to the courses on this app.
title: Unclear

review: The app's learning system is good! And I don't mind paying almost $5 a month for a more advanced learning. But I like to pay for a good quality product. And honestly this could be a good product but it has too many typos, undefined samples and syntax errors everywhere! This is a big problem since it breaks the learning process, making it hard to understand what is happening in some examples. Like I said I like the app, but I am not sure if I will keep paying for it if these errors are not fixed. And I'm sure I am not the only one that thinks like this. Also, if the typo problems are fixed, I might add five stars, even recommend the app to anyone interested in learning programing.
title: Good but not great (Too many errors)

developerResponse: {'id': 7895735, 'body': "Thanks for your kind words! The paid subscription allows us to continue developing Mimo and implementing features that our users want, and pay for our dedicated team. We've shared your review with the rest of the team. It is such a great motivation. We hope this helps and please reach out to support@getmimo.com if you have any other questions. Have a great day!", 'modified': '2019-03-25T14:19:58Z'}
review: For months now I became interested in coding phones, computer, and etc. When I saw this ad I was immediately intrigued to see what‚Äôs it about, and when I saw it I immediately downloaded it. Though interested in it I knew there was gonna be a cost at the start which upsets me a little because I know personally that basically everyone doesn‚Äôt want to have to pay that. So I did the free lessons and liked how it started with different real life examples such as on the ‚Äúhacking‚Äù part how it explained it really simple, and talked about how it was like making a peanut butter jelly sandwich which was cool. Overall, really cool app for people interested in starting up coding, but expect to pay either monthly or yearly fees.
title: Amazing

review:
I'm pretty annoyed. I have a busy schedule and only have a few spare minutes a day to use this app. However, when I open it, the premium content is "locked." I "restore purchase" and it says, "Successful!" -- but then the content remains locked.

It's ridiculous. I shouldn't have to restore my purchase -- after all, it remembers my course progress but can't remember my subscription? But even when I DO restore -- the content is still locked!

I like the app, but when I waste time trying to restore purchases over and over again with no success, I'm done with this! I've deleted the app, reinstalled and "restored purchase" and still it doesn't work.

Sorry, I'm cancelling my subscription and deleting this app for good. I have better things to do with my time than fight this. Ironically, a company that alleges to teach programming might ought hire some programmers that understand how to handle subscription payments.

To be fair in this review though, I really like the content, I think the UI and UX is nice and the lesson format is fun and engaging.
title: Premium needs to be constantly re-unlocked

developerResponse: {'id': 5521344, 'body': 'Hi Ronnie. Thank you so much for the lovely review. Our team is thrilled to hear that you enjoy your courses. Keep on having fun while learning to code!', 'modified': '2018-10-16T09:55:14Z'}
review: This app teaches you more than coding it teaches you a life skill that we need now for our benefit. Also it offers different options like hacking, game development, coding , and building apps also website developing and so much more in-depth coding. At the same time it is easy to understand and pretty straight  forward. If you really want to learn this it comes with a price though but right now it has an offer for 1 year payment you only pay 30 dollars which is 2.50 dollars. It‚Äôs not for long time though so better get it soon!
title: Actually pretty awesome

review: The app has a Duolingo look and feel which I really liked at first. I had high hopes considering I used Duolingo for free and enjoyed it. Honestly thought I would get more out of this app before they asked me to pay up but it was immediately after the first lesson. The first lesson was a joke and taught me nothing. The payment options were $50 for the year or $30 for 3 month. Now the $50 comes out to just over $4 a month but it‚Äôs a lump sum. I‚Äôm sorry but I can‚Äôt pay $50, or even $30, for an app that took 5 min of my life to tell me programming is like making a PB&J or opening a door and then ask me to pay for the rest. There needs to be a longer trial period or a lower barrier to entry because I have no faith that the rest of the lessons will be worth my money. Until then this app will be getting deleted.
title: Not so free

review: This is Duolingo for coding and it is fantastic. And It actually makes sense to download and Try for free, then buy the service in the app, considering its actually quite a big investment. but you get a lot of useful and engaging courses. I would feel much more comfortable paying 25, when it asked 50 I hestitated for a couple days but particularly for me it turned out to be worth it... just barely. I highly recommend the app if you dont mind paying a bit more than its worth. however i really think they need to lower the price...
title: Engaging and valuable resource

review:
I would definitely call myself an intermediate coder, and I downloaded the app hoping that I could play around with it and see if I wanted to buy access to a track or a language course.

There just isn‚Äôt enough material available for free for me to decide whether I would actually get any benefit from it‚Äîespecially for languages like R or Python where there are fairly comprehensive tutorials from the ground up (that is, assuming zero programming knowledge) for free. Although I would love to further develop my skills and learn some new ones, I have no idea whether this app would actually help me out or not‚Äîand i thought it might give me access to intermediate material since I indicated that I had some experience coding!
title: Not enough preview for an intermediate coder

Don‚Äôt fall for this horrible scam!!!! Basically I just recently used this app again and it still didn‚Äôt work! BTW this app made my phone üì± laggy!!!!! My god!
title: How rude!

review:
Doing the math on the premium settings it is clearly overpriced. It advertises the C++ course to last 4.5 hours. However, doing the introductory topic took me 5 minutes and it has a total of 11 topics, so in theory I could complete a course in a 1/5 of the time advertised. I added all of the advertised content (only counting courses once if they exist within a track) and got 75.5 hours of content. When I divided it by 5 it actually take 15 hours to complete the app. $30 for 15 hours is $2 an hour.

I don‚Äôt know the quality of the premium features, but the demo features were very basic and asked obvious questions that make you feel like you are learning but you won‚Äôt remember anything the next day. I‚Äôm going to consider free alternatives that are more thorough and useful.
title: Overprice, overrated

review:
The concept is decent and I'd love to continue to use the app if they didn't immediately ask you to subscribe for $30 or $50.

I took one lesson where I answered incredibly basic questions about things like opening a door or making a sandwich. The app then praised me for being so incredibly smart and didn't allow me to take the next lesson until I upgraded to a paid plan.

I'm afraid this app wasn't built to encourage actual learning but to sucker millennials into buying after telling us how smart and special we are.
title: Immediately Upsells You

review: This is a great app. I really enjoy the carefully designed courses that you can interact with and learn from without intensive typing or watching long videos. Great range of languages to choose from, with a real depth of information in each of them. The only problem is the subscription... the app is DEFINITELY worth paying for, but I think a one-time fee or a lower subscription price is needed. I really respect the developer for the work they have done, but the subscription price is just too much in my opinion.
title: Sooo much potential!

review:
I stopped using this app quite early into buying a year subscription. I did come back to it here and there because I did pay for a year‚Äôs subscription but it wasn‚Äôt enough to keep me using the app.

My issue is with the automatic renewal. I had no warning email or a notification that I was going to get charged for another year. Two days ago, I checked my emails and I get an invoice from them. So I immediately cancelled my account and emailed them requesting a refund and explained my situation. They said that it‚Äôs in the terms and conditions. And that they sent the email out that the auto renewal was coming and that it might have been in my spam folder. I checked my spam folder because it could have been true that I missed it since I never check that thing. Gmail does not delete spam for 30 days and so i looked through and no email. 

But the invoice was able to find its way through to my inbox pretty well... it doesn‚Äôt make sense.

In the end they only refunded me 50% of the annual subscription back because ‚Äúthey put some thought into the situation‚Äù. I still feel robbed.
title: Automatic Renewal

review:
For the record I can say that I‚Äôve been working with this app since January, so I‚Äôm not new to it and this is a long term dissatisfaction. 

This app looks extremely exciting for someone like me who learns best through broken down interactive courses in a visually appealing manner. HOWEVER, it turned out to be a huge disappointment because the wording of the features in this app implied to me that there would be some sort of practice setup for each module you‚Äôve completed. There is NOT. You are expected to complete the module and then move on with your life without any opportunities to self-improve. I, and I assume most people, can‚Äôt retain information that way. The day they bring a practice platform to this app is the day I‚Äôll resubscribe.
title: HUGE disappointment: no practice activities

review: What an awesome app, i put programming down for a long time and saw this and thought id pick it back up, very glad i chose this app to do that with. Have had many app ideas for a while that id love to just get my hands dirty with and develop all the way through. Perfect walkthrough from the ground up on how to exactly what you want. Provides you with many tools to help explore the opportunities and possibilities with programming in different languages... 5/5 must download for anyone interested in learning how to make computers work for you.
title: Wow

review:
When you start it up, you think to yourself...‚Äùok, cool app.‚Äù Then, after you‚Äôre done with the first lesson and it tells you you‚Äôll be reminded tomorrow for your next lesson, again you think, cool! However, the only reminder ‚Äútomorrow‚Äù is a subscription if you‚Äôd like to continue.

Here‚Äôs the thing guys, it would be worth it if it was $2.99 a month. NOT for the current amount they‚Äôre asking. There are SOOO many free resources out there and programming books you can view for free on websites, as well as interactive coding sites like codeacademy and others with built in shells for practicing.

In a nut shell, this is a complete rip off, and I don‚Äôt appreciate how they make it look like the subscription is optional at first.
title: Misleading

review: You can try the first couple lessons for free then you‚Äôll need to pay for it. I paid $40 for one year and now have access to all lessons on my device and the website. The learning is interesting and self-paced. I‚Äôm not a coder but these lessons make it easy to use programming languages as to learn coding concepts. They have a way of taking a coding concept and relating it to something very common so you get the idea of what it accomplishes or what it is used for. I enjoy learning this way.
title: Worth the price of admission!

review: This app is a great way to learn the basics while on the go.  It shines in those times when you find yourself waiting but don't have a laptop at your disposal. The lessons are succinctly worded and logically ordered with each step gradually progressing toward the overall goal. It has a nice achievement system to keep you motivated.  While in the midst of accomplishing an achievement there is a bit of a gap where I find myself wishing I could track my status, but overall the system is effective.  Great app!
title: Effective and Convenient

title: Applying for boot camps, starting here

title: Great app

review: The all seemed promising and I thought it was all completely free. After finishing the first lesson which seemed a little to simple (stuff like spelling ‚Äúprint‚Äù and putting 1,2 and 3 in the right order) I was shown a pay wall of $10 a month. This seemed way to steep to me for what the application had shown me. The beginning lesson showed me absolutely nothing except that I can spell and count. The developers show they care about the app and their customers but they‚Äôve got to implement more, way more before I‚Äôd be willing to spend that much money on this. I could learn swift from other sources for free. Has potential but it just isn‚Äôt there yet.
title: Has promise but executed very poorly.

review:
The app seems polished and operates very well. And as someone who has literally no programming experience, I was excited to get started. And in there lies the problem. The app takes you through an ‚Äúintroduction‚Äù course and after that, all the courses are restricted unless you pay for the monthly subscription. I would have zero problem paying for a subscription for something that I know I want to use. But how am I supposed to know that this app is right for me if I don‚Äôt have some kind of free trial? Doesn‚Äôt even have to be long. Give us a 3 day free trial. 
Until I can feel comfortable with making the purchase, I won‚Äôt be a customer.
title: I wouldn‚Äôt bother

review:
The content is good (aside from some odd typos that could reflect how seriously the developers take their content), but you'll get blocked from proceeding after 2 lessons unless you upgrade to the subscription. As I'm focused on learning specific languages for specific reasons, I don't want access to the full library. So, an a la carte option would be appreciated. Otherwise this is bit pricey for knowledge that is available FOR FREE online. 

Also you have to tweet or post to Facebook to gain access to the second "free" lesson, so that's a bit weird. But I just deleted be tweet right after I posted. Thanks for almost nothing, Mimo!
title: Decent content - absurdly expensive

review: It seems like a great app -better than solo learn maybe- but you only get to try the very first intro segment of lessons before you hit the surprisingly expensive paywall.  Sure the openers seem great but I want to experience the lessons a bit longer to make sure it‚Äôs working before I commit to such a pricey investment.  If I were able to sample more, I could be inclined to pay up, but I don‚Äôt feel comfortable doing so not knowing the quality after the intros.   If I could experience a lesson a bit longer, I might buy in.  I hope the devs make the demo longer
title: Devs, consider a larger demo allowance. Paywall too fast

But it is an ok app to go over things you already study with some other detailed source. I would give 5 stars if they would add more detailed explanations and examples and more work per sections. review: If you are getting into coding, this is not an alternative to some websites like codeacademy, but it can be a good start if you start at a young age to ease into the basics. My brother majored in computer science and got a job in cyber security after several recommendations for his field. It is very difficult and time consuming if you‚Äôre thinking of going serious in this field, but it is in high demand. This is an excellent choice for work and having a bright future, it is the future. Hope you found this insightful.

review: I‚Äôm well on my way to building a website with the instructions of this app but you have to pay a subscription for each devise you want to use it on. (Fix this by working on the projects on whatever device you want, and use the instructions on the device you bought a subscription on) ;)
title: Great website but you have to pay multiple subscriptions?

review: This could be a great app, but I have no way of knowing. The preview is smoothly executed, but demonstrates absolutely nothing about how the app teaches coding. To find out if it's good or not, you have to buy a pig in a poke -- that is, you have to spend money to purchase a subscription (either $30 for three months or $50 for a year) before you get to see what the course is actually like. (Compare this to classes like those offered by Udemy, which generally let you view lessons from different points in the course, in order to get a feel for what the lessons are actually like.) As I said, it could be excellent, but I'm not gambling $30-50 to find out.

review: This app would be amazing, and it nails the teaching process almost like Duolingo does. But, after the app is free to purchase, it stops you with a ‚Äúpremium membership‚Äù option which costs $30 or more per year, and it does not let you learn any programming languages if that membership is not purchased. Basically, this app is designed to trap people into paying way too much money for an app that, while incredibly helpful, is not worth what it called (approx) $7.50 a month or $2.50 per month per year.
title: Amazing, if you‚Äôre rich and can afford the price tag

review:
As a total beginner to all things coding, I've been begging for someone to make an intuitive and imbedded program to make it straight forward to learn coding. Codeacademy does this on PC but having this on mobile is crucial.

Mimo nailed that need. I get others complaints about no monthly option but 50 dollars for one whole year of access to coding on your phone is a steal.
title: Great concept and easy way to learn

developerResponse: {'id': 4651774, 'body': "Hi Slider146, This is really great feedback and we're really glad you've been enjoying Mimo so far. We've been thinking about a cool feature to address this issue and when users like you let us know, it helps us figure out what to work on next. Thank you, The Mimo Team", 'modified': '2018-08-14T13:24:52Z'}
review: Its cool that I don‚Äôt have to flip my phone on the side or anything to get on the app. I can take a quick lesson whenever i have a free 15 minutes and its so cool. I‚Äôm learning bits by bits. The reason why i didn‚Äôt give it a 5 star is because i just wish sometimes it would be a tad bit more specific and explain more what words mean. But overrall i think its great. Yeah its pricey but I luckily subscribed when a 50 percent off deal was goin on lol. But so far so good.
title: Pretty neat- new user

review:
With the minimal options to test out the programming u learn. There's not much to go on with the (free part) by this I mean someone who is just starting programming or is interested in the app to learn programming can't really get a good understanding of the benifit's programming can offer, therefore losing interest and possible subscriptions. 

But the app does break down the lessons to which there easier to understand and learn. If u know at least a little bout programming
title: Options

developerResponse: {'id': 7491970, 'body': 'Hi there. We\'re sorry to hear that. Have you tried pressing "restore purchases" within the settings area of the app? Please email support@getmimo.com if you need any help with anything. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2019-02-27T10:55:17Z'}
review: It‚Äôs a great app. But there‚Äôs one thing that annoys me. Which is the fact that it takes so many tries on logging in and out, deleting and downloading the app to make my subscription works on my multiple devices. I‚Äôm trying to log in on my new iPhone right now and it won‚Äôt let me access it. It‚Äôs really slowing me down on my progress.
title: Great app but one annoying problem

review:
I‚Äôm writing this review to express that I am glad that I paid to gain access the rest of the content of this application. It‚Äôs a great way to keep learning if your not near your computer/laptop/book. If you‚Äôre a fellow student in learning, I would definitely recommend this.

Developers, please keep up the good work and keep adding more content and latest technologies.
title: Best App

review: This is an awesome little app that teaches you very useful skills. The only downside is someone who is interested but not quite yet sure that they want to learn this has no choice but to pay $50 a year. I believe if it was broken down to say ten dollars for a single month or $15 for two or three months would be great. It would give someone who is intrigued a chance to open doors without opening their wallets too much. I hope this opinion gets some thought.
title: Subscription needs revised.

review: I am an I.T major and I signed up for a Java programming class. This app is pretty good but there are websites online that are completely free. I like how it has the pure basics like introducing the class and gives you feedback on what you did wrong. Much like working with an ide. If it was free a lot of people who want to know programming would definetly look at it because it would be right on there phone.
title: Java programmer

review: I greatly enjoyed how they breakdown these seemingly complex concepts down to their absolute basics. I really do/did want to continue  studying the program. However, I got hung up with the subscription. To continue using the apps full content you'll need to either pay a monthly fee of around $5, or a yearly cost of about $60. This really isn't a poor request from the creators, but I would have preferred to pay a one time fee and leave it at that.
title: Great idea! Not a big fan of Subscriptions.

developerResponse: {'id': 523586, 'body': "Thanks for your honest feedback. We appreciate it. We try to deliver high-class tutorials and the best user experience possible. We want to be transparent; that's why we allow you to try the app before paying.", 'modified': '2017-06-08T07:46:13Z'}
review: I did the first two chapters for free then came across that I had to pay in order to continue. Overall I think it's a pretty good app. The only thing that was bugging me was how it didn't go into much detail about what you were learning. The descriptions were short and very vague. Also I wish they would allow you to go back to previous pages while in the lesson. I am going to search around and look at a very other apps before I decided to purchase this one.
title: Being honest

review:
I know some of you have complained about pricing but I think the cost is justified and reasonable.
I work at a job that requires knowledge of various programming languages and though I can hack my way through them it's nice to have a source at the end of the day where I can start making sense of everything.
$50/52weeks=96¬¢week
That's fair! Merica
I'll make it up on my next raise! ;-)
title: Can only get better

review: I purchased this app in preparation for a program in the "coming soon" section.  By purchase, I mean I paid an over priced $50 subscription which is per year.  Two months have gone by and they still have not released the class for which I bought a subscription and in that time I have found alternative trading which is free.  The free version of this app is pointless and the paid is overpriced.  I have it two stars because I found a couple course helpful, but more useless than helpful.  I wore to support and they gave me no useful answers.  Avoid this app, it's only disappointing.
title: Disappointed

review:
Interested in the app but they really don't give enough to get you interested, even with 2 chapters each language. The first two chapters are very basic so you're not really learning anything, and then they want you to pay $50 upfront to unlock the rest.

I would be willing to try one month at a higher monthly price just to see if it's something I'm interested in purchasing a yearly subscription for, but I'm not gonna drop $50 for a yearly subscription on something I don't know works.

Obviously, I'm not the only person who feels this way. Look at the rest of the reviews!
title: Full $50 Upfront?? No way!

developerResponse: {'id': 152653, 'body': 'Thank you very much for your report! It\'s awesome that you contribute to Mimo to help us increase the quality. \nIn Swift, variables (in the narrower sense) and constants fall under the term "variables" as named containers for values: "Like C, Swift uses variables to store and refer to values by an identifying name. Swift also makes extensive use of variables whose values cannot be changed. These are known as constants [...]"\nYou can have a detailed look at the Apple documentation here: https://developer.apple.com/library/content/documentation/Swift/Conceptual/Swift_Programming_Language/TheBasics.html', 'modified': '2017-04-14T12:32:53Z'}
review: In the training for Swift, the instructional material contradicted the test.  Both were using common uses of the word "variable" but one was technically correct and the other was not.  I pointed this out to the creators and instead of thanking me for pointing out the error, they defended one of the uses and ignored the other.  Of course one of them is correct.  Obviously.  It wouldn't even be such a big deal if they would have used them consistently, but since they can't be bothered to even have a bare minimal level of quality control, AND they have the rudeness to deny an obvious and irrefutable error, they get one star.
title: Poorly written materials

developerResponse: {'id': 4558718, 'body': 'Hi LarsenJM!Many thanks for using Mimo and for submitting your review! We are very happy to hear that you like learning with our app. Keep on coding and have a wonderful day! Cheers! Your Mimo Team', 'modified': '2018-08-07T12:03:43Z'}
review:
I think this app can be a great compliment to other channels of programming (CS50 on edX, freecodecamp etc.), especially the security section gives you a great introduction on how to secure a website or service you are building.
I subscribed for one year and made the most of it with. 
If one year is enough for you, make sure to cancel the subscription before it‚Äôs over.
title: Useful App for beginners

review: was really enjoying the app and felt like I was learning. has a sort of duolingo feel with a slightly less academic vibe. graphically neat and easy to follow. only thing is- $50 a year? I can't justify spending that on something that's at most a casual hobby and at least something to pick up and mess with every week or so. unless you have the time to really sit down, everyday, for maybe  an hour or two and *learn*, this app just isn't worth it. props to the developers for a great idea and great app- they deserve some profit, but asking so much is going to deter it
title: great until...

review:
I downloaded today and I am under build an app. I completed the Programming 1 and completed the 9/9 on ‚ÄúGetting started‚Äù. I see programming 2 is available but I can‚Äôt open it. I can‚Äôt open anything else either except the Programming 1 and getting started. Is this just a demo and I have to pay for the rest? 

Please help because I was having fun before this happened.
title: NEED HELP.

developerResponse: {'id': 4555592, 'body': 'Hi Haantiexo! Many thanks for using Mimo and for your lovely review. Our team is thrilled to hear that you love our app! And yes, we have good news - new courses will be soon available - for example React. Keep on having fun while learning to code! Have a great day! Your Mimo Team', 'modified': '2018-08-07T09:03:36Z'}
review:
I just bought the monthly subscription to try out more after debating for few weeks.

I am someone who has zero knowledge on all the things this app offers to teach, yet I find it pretty doable keeping up with the course. 
English isnt even my first language but they made it pretty simple and easy to understand the basic. 
I hope you guys come up with more courses though!
title: Loving it

review:
I was excited to try this app, but disappointed that the subscription is required before learning anything.

For hacking, All I got was a lecture on the ethics of black vs. white hat hacking. After looking over the other courses, it appears similar. In order to progress past the intro, you must subscribe.

Let us at least try the ‚Äúcoding content‚Äù before subscribing. Why not make the first quarter free, so we can see if this app actually does what it says before having to shell out cash.
title: No real content

review:
I've heard lots of people ask how they can learn to program or make a website. This will cover the basics and fundamentals fast even to someone who has never interacted with programming before.

While you need a subscription to use the app after each of the first sections, this gives an accurate preview before continuing.
title: Ever heard someone say they want to learn programming?

review: My first experience with upgrading to premium. The way the buttons are designed it looks like you can pay for the $50 for the year or $4 a month. When I click $4 a month, a window pops up say you will be charge for the $50 for the year. I'd like the option to pay the $4 month to month for this. I'm curious about continuing, but one lesson trial is not enough to get me hooked. I don't know if I want to pay $50 right off the bat. Even if it is for the whole year. I would change my star rating if there were a more flexible payment option. Thank you.
title: Flexible payment option please!

review: I love this app! It takes me through the steps to learn an entirely new language from virtually no experience. I problem I have with this is the curriculum. I would like a feature to ‚Äútest out‚Äù of things that I already know about. Sorry if I sound needy or like a beggar, but I don‚Äôt like having to go through the lessons I had already went through.
title: It very good but...

review: Just started using this... I was super sleepy but all of a sudden, it had me so excited that I was annoyed by the wait time on my next challenge lol! Love this app so far.. the fact that they make you type out codes makes memorizing a whole lot easier! So many options to learn from. Thank you for taking the time to create this!
title: New to this

developerResponse: {'id': 5258152, 'body': 'Hi there. Many thanks for using Mimo and for your feedback - we much appreciate it. Our team is pleased to hear that you like the newly added courses. Keep on having fun while learning to code!', 'modified': '2018-10-14T02:48:30Z'}
review:
Update: ever since the first day I‚Äôve downloaded the app, there have been a HELL LOT of new courses added.
Now, the depth of the content taught isn‚Äôt deep, but as someone who (1 likes to learn a little about everything programming and (2 only has minutes to learn a bit of programming outside of school, Mimo works very well!
2nd Update: THANK YOU for putting these courses on a website! It felt like mimo was too limited without a website
title: SO MUCH TO LEARN

review: I was really excited to start using the app because it seems very user friendly, has a nice interface, and explains the content pretty well. After finishing the first two lessons however, it requires you to purchase premium. The premium costs around $5 a month, which is a very reasonable amount, except that you HAVE to pay for a full year, which is expensive and unjustified. I would have continued if I could have had a monthly subscription, but refuse to get the subscription for a full year.
title: Great content, not worth the $

developerResponse: {'id': 5325232, 'body': "Hi there Tito. Wow - what a lovely review, thank you so much. Keep on having fun while learning to code!", 'modified': '2018-10-02T10:59:07Z'}
review:
This is a great program for anyone who wants to learn regardless of how much background you have. It starts at the very very beginning and walks you through slowly. You can move backwards or forwards through the app if you forget something or want to skip ahead and look at something else. Very flexible.

‚ÄîScotty Saunders
title: Work at your own speed. No condescending.

review:
This app is a lot of fun and the amount of content available is worth going premium at least once.

Although this application covers a broad spectrum of fundamentals extremely well, it should NOT be your only source of education when it comes to programming, cryptography, etc.

Use it to solidify the things you DO know, and to start learning the things you DON'T know.
title: L3GI7

review: I‚Äôm a senior mechanical engineering student with a mechatronics concentration. Although mechatronics uses coding...a lot, I‚Äôm not the biggest fan, but this app makes the learning and practice actually easy and enjoyable. Granted I just started using the app, and already know what I‚Äôm learning, but I can definitely see this improving my coding knowledge. I might even try making an iOS App.
title: ME enjoying coding!?!?

developerResponse: {'id': 3238351, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. We charge a subscription because the money helps us to produce new high-quality content that we then are able to offer to ower subscribers. Nevertheless, we'll be sure to increase the amount of free content in the near future ‚Äì hang in there! If you have additional feedback, please let us know. You can either answer directly to this review or send us an email to feedback@getmimo.com We're looking forward to hearing from you!", 'modified': '2018-04-24T08:28:07Z'}
review:
So the first lesson is free, anything after that costs a three month or one year subscription. Save your money and use codecademy unless you absolutely need an app lesson like this...

The lessons themselves are not bad and put things into an easy to understand perspective; it also has several different languages and all.

I give it a 3/5, would certainly give it 5/5 if it was a one time fee for the app or had many more free lessons.
title: Expensive version of available online resources

review:
I‚Äôm incredibly impressed with this app. I don‚Äôt have a lot of experience with coding of any kind but wanted to start learning and I‚Äôm glad I came across MIMO. 

It‚Äôs interface is extremely user friendly, the options for where to start are fun and goal focused and the lessons are amazingly intuitive. 

It provides a fun and unintimidating place to learn.
title: Excellent App

developerResponse: {'id': 3798946, 'body': 'Hi ctryguy, thank you for your feedback! We offer the first chapter of every course for free and then ask you for a subscription, which you can find written in the App Store description before downloading. We hope to welcome you back at a later point in time with new features. Your team at Mimo.', 'modified': '2018-06-11T13:15:31Z'}
review:
I downloaded this to learn more about Swift and try to understand it.  I was very disappointed after discovering that only the ‚ÄúGetting started‚Äù, 12 very simple basic instructions were free and that to learn anything more about Swift you will have to subscribe to there service.  

And the service is $120 per year unless you subscribe within the first 24 hours of opening the 2nd lesson.  Then the cost is only $30.  I don‚Äôt object to the lower price, I might even consider paying $30, but to have to decide within the first 24 hours and only seeing 12 very simplistic lessons caused me to write this 1 star review, and I usually DON‚ÄôT write reviews.

I will find other products that are free to determine if I want to continue to learning SWIFT.  I will not be subscribing to this product.

Shame on the developers for what I consider a bait and switch approach to learning a programming language.
title: App Misrepresents itself - It‚Äôs NOT FREE

review: This was just the app I needed. Something nice and interactive to help me learn coding without having to use that boring drag-and-drop ‚Äòblock‚Äô thing that a lot of websites use. Well, turns out I have to pay 50 bucks a year! I‚Äôd be fine with paying a smaller price for just one portion of the app, but there just isn‚Äôt enough stuff to do with all of this for $50. I can‚Äôt even continue on to the real coding stuff until I get a subscription, and the first lesson was basic knowledge questions. So, yeah, pretty disappointed.
title: Looked like a great coding app...

review: I‚Äôd prefer a platform that allows me to build my own quizzes and flash cards. I‚Äôd hoped to use this as a quiz system for reinforcing my C++ book, but the C++ content seems very limited and simplistic. I don‚Äôt have trouble remembering how to increment an integer variable, for instance. Declaring a function pointer and handling memory addressing is something I could use quizzing on. In the end, a good flash card app that adapts to your knowledge gaps and allows you to create your own content is a better option.
title: Very introductory

review:
First of all I like the idea behind this apps. It‚Äôs great and amazing. However, there is no information explain the coding for beginners. When I started the app it just giving me examples and questions to answers. Now I‚Äôm studying R and terminal in school so,how we learn in school. First we go through lecture and introduction for the topic to understand the basic behind this coding before we move to R or Terminal and do some work/exercisesthere. I think in my opinion if you guys make small introductions with explain before the training session that would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance :)
title: No information for beginners

developerResponse: {'id': 7491922, 'body': "Hi there. We've introduced a free trial that lasts for 7 days so that you can check out Mimo for free and see if you like it. The free trial does not bind you to a subscription, however, after the trial, you need the paid subscription to continue to have unlimited access to all of the content. The paywall that you're seeing shows that there is a free trial and that you need a paid subscription after that. The payment details are saved with your account so that your premium access ends if the payment doesn't go through or if you cancel your subscription. You can cancel during the trial and then you won't be charged for a subscription. However, the subscription allows us to continue developing Mimo and pay salaries and rent. Please email support@getmimo.com if you have any questions. Have a great day!", 'modified': '2019-02-27T10:52:46Z'}
review:
Should‚Äôve probably looked more into the app before downloading, but the App of the Day article said this would be a great app to learn coding off of. That might be true, but I wouldn‚Äôt know since I‚Äôm hit with a paywall before the very first lesson. Ok, so... How about the challenge? Also a paywall.

I have to laugh a bit, honestly. How do you call them ‚Äúpremium members‚Äù if you have to pay to even use the application in the first place? Probably has potential, but I‚Äôd rather get an actually free lesson or two of ACTUAL coding practice without the trial so I know what I‚Äôm getting into.
title: Didn‚Äôt even get a chance

developerResponse: {'id': 4553692, 'body': 'Hi Alejandro! Thank you so much for your kind words! We are very happy to hear that you find Mimo a great app for beginners! Keep on having fun while learning to code! Cheers! Your Mimo Team', 'modified': '2018-08-07T07:27:06Z'}
review: This is a great app for beginners and for you to learn, I personally love how it‚Äôs so easy to understand and it doesn‚Äôt just through everything at you at once. It lets you go at your own pace. I love this app I don‚Äôt mind paying $2.00 a year to learn something great and in a wonderful way! Keep making easy ways for people to learn thanks you!
title: Great

review: This app is so fun and educational at the same time! I find it silly that I was just being ‚Äúlazy‚Äù one day and I was on a ‚ÄúApp Store shopping spree‚Äù and I saw the ‚Äúlearn something‚Äù section and at first I was like; ‚ÄúThis is probably stupid and not fun‚Äù But I was so bored that I clicked on it and I loved it! So I learned; ‚Äúdon‚Äôt judge a book by its cover‚Äù (or a app in this case) because this app is super fun and the opposite of STUPID!
title: So fun!

review: I love this app and wish I could spend more time using it but I'm only able to access very few lessons for free. It's frustrating because I want to learn more but don't want to pay the fee for premium. title: Premium Subscription is unfortunately necessary

developerResponse: {'id': 4651858, 'body': 'Hi sgt deagle, thank you for the constructive feedback. It certainly puts our focus on areas where we can improve. Happy coding! - The Mimo Team', 'modified': '2018-08-14T13:28:01Z'}
review: So, I‚Äôve seen bad reviews on this but I don‚Äôt see nothing wrong here. Sure, coding might be complicating and the membership is expensive, But I am still motivated to learn these lesson. title: I like it!

review:
First you must have an iPad or a Mac with the software updated to IOS 10.0. 
Wish I would of known before spending $60 to go further into the lessons. Now I'm stuck wait around for this software update to come out for my iPad which won't be released for another 3 months (i believe). I've checked my software and it says it's up to date on software.
