title: You need to know!

developerResponse: {'id': 9224295, 'body': 'Hey there! Thanks for pointing this out. Subsection 7.2 says "This revocation right will exist for a period of fourteen days from the day of the purchase." If as you said, this has been a year ago, this doesn\'t apply, but we do make exceptions, such as in your case. Please have a look at the replies of our support team, I believe you have actually been helped! Have a great day!', 'modified': '2019-06-18T09:51:17Z'}
review:
I purchased a year of use to this service over a year ago. I only used the service for a few days. I didn‚Äôt find it helpful. 

It auto-renewed a few days ago. According to subsection 7 of their Terms and Service you have a right to a full refund within 14 days of purchase if you notify them. I‚Äôve notified them. They said they‚Äôd refund 50%. 

After reading so many reviews complaining about the auto-renewal, I‚Äôd figure I‚Äôd let people who read the reviews know about their terms of service and their business practices.
title: Find another App - Not consumer friendly

review:
Not bad . I would like to suggest a dictionary or a way to see the meaning of a word , not all of them are described. They are just written in bold I‚Äôm currently using the become a hacker section . Thank you for developing this app I look forward to trying the rest of the programs.
Also reading the reviews I‚Äôm confused I did not get a option for a trial I couldn‚Äôt access anything with out paying first .
title: Great but

review: I tried the beginning of the make a game track, but when I tried by premium afterwards, it wouldn‚Äôt let me download it. I mean, I have the right kind of phone, and my mom turned off Qustodio so I could download premium, but it still wouldn‚Äôt let me. Can you tell me what‚Äôs wrong with the app? Thank you.
title: It won‚Äôt let me get premium

review:
Decent UI. Obviously very well made app - functionally. Classic example of a tech team who thinks marketers are imbeciles. It‚Äôs apparent, because the ‚Äúmarketing‚Äù used in this model is exactly what you don‚Äôt do when trying to scale a company. 

You are required to pay a fee with no idea as to what you‚Äôre getting. How deep do these courses go? How can I use them? How detailed are the modules?

Either classic marketing denial or a scam. Based on dev replies, I‚Äôm guessing this is a good app. But common sense tells me not to buy.

Guys: hire a marketer specializing in in-app purchase pricing.   

You need one badly.

As if stands, I would highly recommend LinkedIn Learning for a higher price, but guaranteed challenges and guaranteed learning. 

#investinmarketing
title: 3 star: you are forced to buy something before you know what it is.

review: I am a retired programmer from 15 years ago with a disability. I found this app, and really enjoy it so far! I thought I could never master this crap again, but I seem to really enjoy my natural curiosity of programming! review:
I would like to learn some sort of programming language and figured this would be similar to DuoLingo in how it‚Äôs constructed, which is sort of is. Difference is that DuoLingo has ads (now) so the content is still free but there is an option to pay if so choosing. title: Wanted To Like It

developerResponse: {'id': 3680858, 'body': "Hi hdkcbftm! Thank you for your feedback. title: Absolute Scam

review: I'm going into coding for high school and wanted to give myself an advantage by learning before hand. This app allows you to learn the certain processes that come along with coding, but you can only go so far in the app until you have to pay a premium, 5 dollars monthly and 56 dollars for an entire year. The colors are nice but it seems design or function has taken over, don't know how much longer I'm willing to pay a subscription with it like this.
title: Great app before update

review:
i‚Äôve seen you say in other replies that the subscription price is high to be able to pay salaries and rent and such- forgive me as i‚Äôm not well versed in these things,,
say someone like me is passionate about the idea of coding, but doesn‚Äôt have money to spare to pay the subscription price, whether that be because they‚Äôre struggling or because they‚Äôre a minor and don‚Äôt have much money. 
take an app education app like duolingo for example- they a subscription option that removes adds, gives some more content, but all of their main courses are available and have adds at the end so they can still make money. 
i feel as if that could be better, but like i said, im not sure how these things really work.
title: thoughts and recommendations

review: You should have different subscription term options. Why would we want to pay for an entire year if we only want to learn one language? Or maybe we decide programming just isn't for us? You're limiting your customer base. I wanted to use this app just to keep my brain constantly going and thinking about certain languages throughout the day, but I don't want to pay for a year.
title: Needs different subscription options

review: At first glance I thought this app was a really cool, immersive experience. That was until I learned that you essentially had to pay to unlock these courses. I‚Äôm still going to give this app 4 stars because it seems like it knows what it‚Äôs talking about, and the design is very sleek. And, although this is only inferring, I bet the learning experience-of you paid for it -would be nice.
title: Paid Learning

review:
This app is great as a precursor to a class with something like Udemy. It's not so high level that if you're new you'll be put off, but it's not so dumb that people who know programming will be too bored. It's always good to go back to the basics and it certainly helps you teach others. 

Very well done application, awesome user interface. :)
title: Good starting point

review: Honestly, Mimo is such an entertaining and sweet app! I know it requires a subscription but there are also a lot of free topics. The subscription itself only costs ten dollars per month. I think this is a pretty good deal. I have been on mimo for a while now, and it taught me so much! I think if anything it should be worth more than it is üòÇ
title: Yes, I paid

developerResponse: {'id': 2574383, 'body': "I'm sorry if we've given that impression, it's not our intention. We want to be transparent; that's why we allow you to try the app before paying.", 'modified': '2018-02-13T15:55:20Z'}
review: Says it's free but you only get to do one lesson on the free version. And it teaches you nothing about coding, only useless step by step directions such as how to make a pb&j sandwich. And when you do buy the subscription, you would have to redo lessons multiple times to understand if you are a beginner. Not a very good app. Wouldn't recommend it
title: Pretty much a scam

review: This app is great if you are into coding/programming. I myself am into this, that's why I got it. Though I kind of wish you could use more than just one chapter on each subject. I don't feel like paying to do that. But if you are willing to, then go ahead. But other than that this is a great app for learning hacking, programming, making websites, and an app I'd be happy to own.

Keep on learning to code and have a great day!", 'modified': '2018-08-21T09:47:42Z'}
review: This issue I‚Äôm having with that app is the actual learning process doesn‚Äôt feel like it will stick with me. Lessons are so quick I don‚Äôt actually feel like I‚Äôm learning anything. I would suggest a more in depth approach so I actually know what I‚Äôm learning and why. This is definitely a good app for beginners and people new to coding but it doesn‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm actually learning it feels more like I‚Äôm just inputting the answers without actually retaining the knowledge.
title: Still not sure if this actually works

review:
This app is great. I feel it it being unfairly rated because people are upset they actually have to invest $9/month for quality content that can improve themselves and their life. It's really sad and kind of ridiculous how people except everything to be free.

Worth every penny! Keep up the great work devs!
title: Paying for Quality

review: First basic lesson (defining what coding is) is free, but before you even find out if it‚Äôs capable of teaching you, it asks for a 3 month or year long pay commitment. Sorry but without something as basic as a 3 day trial, there‚Äôs no reason to just randomly throw money at this app. Could be great and super helpful for all I know, but their pricing structure is currently not one I‚Äôm interested in. Every coding class I‚Äôve seen offered IRL lets you back out after 1-2 sessions of actual teaching, full refund. I‚Äôll go with that option.
title: Free part offers no insight to what subscription offers

developerResponse: {'id': 5554643, 'body': 'Hi there. Thank you so much for the kind words. Our team is thrilled to hear that you are enjoying our courses. Keep up the good work and have a great day!', 'modified': '2018-10-18T08:13:52Z'}
review: Especially if followed along with Xcode. I can‚Äôt speak for everyone of course, but in terms of retaining the information, the short little snippets and explanations work perfectly for me.  This app is a primary example that anyone can learn anything, it is just a matter of how it is taught and your learning style.
title: Excellent learning method

review: I don't normally ever write reviews but this app truly deserves to be known for exactly what it is and exactly what I've been hoping would come about which is a truly palpable and effective way to understand programming without any prior detailed education in computer language or really of anything much at all.
title: Been looking for this

review: This has potential to be a good app, but it‚Äôs hard to tell because the trial is 3 minutes long. The trial basically just said what programming is, so I still have no idea how they approach teaching the actual programming part. I get wanting to be paid for your app development, but I can‚Äôt pay a cent unless I at least know the teaching style. I don't think the price point is bad ($10/mo or $50/yr) but I just want to know what get for it before committing. Even if they made the trial a whole 10 minutes, I might be able to give a more informed review.
title: In the dark.

review: Well that's a tough question, in my opinion it's a stepping stone. You will learn a decent bit of basics but you won't really learn the advance stuff. Which understandly is usually based off your problem solving skills, however, it's simple and a little fun. My biggest problem with the program is the Amount of questions with multiple answers, those are annoying a tedious and causes a lack of understanding.
title: So is the App a good learning tool?

review: I've tinkered quite a bit with various languages here and there, and while I'm able to get what I need done, it's always great to go over some of the basics from time to time. The education provided in this app is easy to understand and thoughtfully organized. Well worth its price, in my opinion.
title: Great primer or refresher for beginners and/or hobbyists

this app is amazing!
title: Great tiny skill

developerResponse: {'id': 5972778, 'body': "Hi there. Thank you so much for reviewing our app. Our team is so glad to hear that you are enjoying using Mimo. Thanks also for your suggestion. review:
This app is great at breaking down complexities of coding in mini lessons. It‚Äôs interface is beautiful and easy to use. 

Love, love, LOVE the newest lessons on blockchain and Instagram. 

I‚Äôve contacted support before and they were quick to respond. 

I leave off one star because this app would have a more long term impact if there were more summary quiz‚Äôs you could just test your self on until you‚Äôve got a concept down completely. 

Right now I‚Äôve been writing down key points and running them through quizlet. 

Still a fantastic, affordable way to learn coding. I expect they will continue improving it and adding features like I mention above :)
title: Bite sized easy to digest lessons

developerResponse: {'id': 5575752, 'body': 'Hi there. Thank you for using Mimo. Please send us an email at support@getmimo.com to clarify this. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2018-10-19T11:01:37Z'}

Thanks
title: Seemed decent at first

review: I am using this app to learn Python before I take a Mechanical Engineering class where I will have to use Python to program a robot that picks up objects on it‚Äôs own.  This app makes everything easy for me because of the daily tutorials and goals.  So far, I feel more confident that I‚Äôll learn the basics of this language easily.
title: Love This App!

review: This app is easy to use and the way content is delivered, it is also easy to understand. I was looking forward to more content, but with the subscription price (including a ‚Äúdiscount‚Äù of 40%) it is too expensive. Unfortunately, I will look around for other apps now because of the pricing for subscription.
title: Easy to use and understand.

developerResponse: {'id': 6057212, 'body': "Thanks for your kind words! We're thrilled that you are enjoying Mimo. We are very passionate about teaching the world how to code. Thanks again and have a great day!", 'modified': '2018-11-22T11:30:33Z'}
review: What I love about this app the most is the freedom to learn coding within a week. I have this great app idea that can attract average day customers like me and you. This app is gonna help me complete that goal. All tho is someone wouldn‚Äôt mind talking to me about my app and maybe helping for a portion of the profit I wouldn‚Äôt mind.
title: This can help me get rich

review: The cost to actually do any real lessons is a forced subscription ranging from $30-$50. The only free one is an intro that tells you nothing. That‚Äôs a huge gamble for an app that may or may not be any good. Allow people to buy sections for a reasonable cost or drastically reduce the cost of the subscription. Not worth the risk.
title: Way too expensive

developerResponse: {'id': 2466192, 'body': "Hi! We're devastated to hear you say that, since we put a lot of thought and time into designing the format. Please drop us an email so we can make sure that Mimo will work for you, too.", 'modified': '2018-02-01T09:05:56Z'}
review:
I was dumbfounded at how terrible the content was. Poor or simply no explanation, idiotic questions...
Also the app is free but you have to pay for content right away. Only a very tiny amount is available for free (totally enough to judge the poor quality though!)
I was very surprised at how bad it was since the app looked so sleek. It looks like all the efforts went into design and marketing and they forgot to make good courses ‚Äî or didn‚Äôt bother. Save your time and your money and find courses by good teachers who care. There are many out there.
title: Awful pedagogy

review: The name of the app is hilarious: in Russian it reads as "(you've) missed!", which somehow describes my feelings using it. The overall pleasant experience of user friendly teaching process is too short for even the second step costs money. There are much better code-teaching apps that have less greedy monetizing schemes, I will stick to one of such and will pay for premium because it's worth it.
title: Cute but not enough trial levels

review: Apps like that this should offer a secondary app called ‚Äúlite‚Äù so people know before installing that you charge after 5 minutes. You can‚Äôt even see that on the App Store unless you scroll down towards the bottom and read the very end of the last paragraph. It‚Äôs sad that so many people can download, open and start this app without any idea that you‚Äôre going to try to charge them. Very misleading, 1 star. Just so everyone knows, there are plenty of free coding apps that aren‚Äôt nearly as glitchy or buggy as this one.
title: Misleading

review:
Some people are complaining about having to pay for lessons.

Some things in life aren't free and if you want your money's worth, Mimo is a wise choice.

I'm a CS major in community college, because of Mimo I went from knowing only C++ and Java to understanding Ruby, Python, and Swift.  

It's worth it because it's like having an instructor with you, it feels way more organized compared to an online guide.  

Mimo is perfect to get you familiar and ready for a language, what I'd love to see next is projects - where you work with Mimo on making an app or something, where you include an API and everything!

But definitely worth it.
title: Worth it

review: Great app. You can tell how much care and detail went into it. Every second I have free time (public transport, waiting room, couple mins before class) I just open up Mimo and start learning. Good job devs. This is one of the few apps where I feel I'm getting my money's worth of content and knowledge. Keep it up.
title: Kudos

developerResponse: {'id': 5440184, 'body': 'Hi there. Many thanks for using Mimo and for submitting your review. We are pleased to hear that you enjoy our lessons and that you are happy with your purchase. Have a wonderful day and happy coding!', 'modified': '2018-10-10T10:38:44Z'}
review: I‚Äôve had some experience with several different coding languages. I saw this app advertised and figured it wouldn‚Äôt be a bad idea to try it out to help refine what I know and teach me new things. I ended up paying for the yearly subscription and love it. Well worth the money.
title: Great for people of all experience

review: This app seems cool over all, and I understand the idea of making people pay to use it, but I feel that it would be more efficient if you listed the price in the App Store. People don‚Äôt seem to like the idea of subscriptions, especially if they are at the young age of 4 and their parents won‚Äôt let them buy an expensive coding app due to the fact that they might not understand it. Therefore, I give it two stars... it‚Äôs a five star idea though üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª
title: It‚Äôs a cool idea...

review: I‚Äôve used almost every app; from Treehouse to EdX, nothing comes close to Mimo. I‚Äôm a self-taught, aspiring developer. This app takes the complex concept of coding and breaks it into small lessons that anyone, with the desire, can comprehend. Thank you, for thoughtfully developing this app; from the content, to the images, to the ease of use.
title: Best Coding Resource

review: The interface looks nice and the original mini lesson seemed ok, but it's hard to review an app that will only let you see it for a $50 yearly subscription. Offer a trial, either 3 days, 5 days, or a week, or let people pay for the actual monthly sub even at a higher price. With out more time and reviews that show it works in the long run, it's hard to cough up the $50 for the content of the app as you can get the info online for free. Granted maybe not as retry as it is through the app, but still for free.

I use this app, especially when I‚Äôm on my phone and I don‚Äôt have a computer and/or headphones handy. Also great for learning while on a plane with no reception. 

Truth is, for the price it‚Äôs going for, it‚Äôs just not a good value. The subscription business model is terrible for what is offered here. This app is worth maybe $5 tops as a one time fee. I payed $30 for 3 months, lol. 

Most of the info found in it can be found for free in various places on the internet and a lot of Udemy courses, which are $10 and are 100x more thorough and better structured. 

That being said, it‚Äôs a good review tool for various programming topics and it has a cute, albeit sometime forced, sense of humor.

FREAKING
LESSON.
Education should not cost so much.

developerResponse: {'id': 7195078, 'body': "Hi there. We definitely do not sell any user data. We ask you to register, because your courses and progress are saved with your account. This allows you to continue where you've left off on whatever device you log on to. We've introduced a free trial that lasts for 7 days so that you can check out Mimo for free and see if you like it. The free trial does not bind you to a subscription, however, after the trial, you need the paid subscription to continue to have unlimited access to all of the content. The paywall that you're seeing shows that there is a free trial and that you need a paid subscription after that. The payment details are saved with your account so that your premium access ends if the payment doesn't go through or if you cancel your subscription. You can cancel during the trial and then you won't be charged for a subscription. However, the subscription allows us to continue developing Mimo and pay salaries and rent.
